results.definition: consciously restrain from showing; of emotions, desires, impulses, or behavior
limit, block, or decrease the action or function of
examples: inhibit the action of the enzyme
inhibit the rate of a chemical reaction

results.definition: make (someone) self-conscious and as a result unable to act naturally
examples: his father's cold and distant demeanor inhibited him emotionally

results.definition: prohibit, forbid, or prevent from doing something
examples: Contact between the young was inhibited by strict social customs
